title: Name
text: The name of this Work System. (Examples Include: Sales, Human Resources, Information Technology, Production, Finance, Purchasing.)

title: Management System
text: A listing of the management systems that work across multiple phases to ensure that value of the work. (Note: Use the examples in your workbook.)

title: Work Type
text: A descriptive label that names the different work types that flow through the Work System. (Example: High Touch, Low Touch, No Touch

title: Management Rail
text: A simple, concise statement that articulates how work is enabled and ensured to perform.

title: Leadership Rail
text: A simple, concise statement that articulates the purpose ('why') the work is being performed

title: Page Owner
text: The name(s) of the person(s) that owns this Work System. (Hint: Whenever possible this should be one person.)

title: Phase Purpose
text: A simple, concise statement that identifies 'why' this particular phase of work exists

title: Phase Measure
text: A list of potential measures for work in each phase. (Note: In each phase you can always measure 4 items: 1) Time in the phase, 2) First Time Quality, 3) Total Cost, 4) Feedback

title: Phase
text: The name of each phase of work that best describes the work steps

title: Steps Of Work
text: A descriptive label of the process steps that are done in a phase to move to the next gate. (Note: The Dresser Drawer, action verbs, along a continuum of detail/granularity - does it allow the story to be told.)(Note: The order of steps is very important to create flow.)
